messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: One night in 2003, Suzanne Collins was watching television. The news programmes were about the war between the USA and Iraq. Other programmes were competitions between young people trying to win a million dollars. Suzanne says that her brain mixed the two types of programmes together in a worrying way and her story 'The Hunger Games' came from that.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL. The text is a strong attempt but fails due to the inclusion of non-A2 vocabulary. The word 'worrying' is B1 level. The rules demand exclusive use of A2 vocabulary. While the simplification of 'invasion', 'merge', and 'disturbing' is correct, this single error makes the text unacceptable. Adherence must be absolute.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: One night in 2003, Suzanne Collins was watching television. The news programmes were about the war between the USA and Iraq. Other programmes were competitions between young people trying to win a million dollars. Suzanne says that her brain put the two types of programmes together in a bad way and her story 'The Hunger Games' came from that.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The word 'competitions' is B1 level. An A2 text cannot use this vocabulary. A simpler alternative is required, such as 'games where people try to win'. The rest of the text shows good simplification, but this single vocabulary error results in failure.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: One night in 2003, Suzanne Collins was watching television. The news programmes were about the war between the USA and Iraq. Other programmes were games where young people tried to win a million dollars. Suzanne says that her brain put the two types of programmes together in a bad way and her story 'The Hunger Games' came from that.

metadata.feedback_text: The text is a flawless example of A2 simplification. All sentences are simple and use appropriate A2 grammar. Vocabulary is strictly within the A1/A2 range. The simplification of 'merge together in a disturbing way' to 'put the two types of programmes together in a bad way' is exemplary. Factual accuracy is maintained. No errors detected.
